info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 6:28PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Siskiyou, southeastern Jackson and southwestern Klamath Counties through 700 PM PDT... At 627 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Copco Lake, or 24 miles southeast of Ashland. This storm was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Copco Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
